main event: On June 19, 1966, observers in Kettering, Ohio reported seeing a bright object in the sky that resembled Venus, lasting for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed to be brighter than an evening star and changed colors between white and pink,The sighting involved an Air Force plane simultaneously flying nearby,The conclusion reached by investigators was that the sighting was likely a satellite,The object's size was estimated to be similar to that of Venus,There were no photographs or physical evidence from the sighting.
sighted object: a bright object in the sky
